author: CBS Philly
title: Fattah Supporters Request Presidential Pardon

organizations.name: fattah supporters request presidential pardon fattah supporters request presidential

text:
Fattah Supporters Request Presidential Pardon January 12, 2017 9:55 PM By Kristen Johanson Filed Under: Chaka Fattah , Kristen Johanson , Philadelphia 
by Kristen Johanson 
PHILADELPHIA (CBS) — A group of supporters for former Congressman Chaka Fattah have sent a letter to the President, just as he gets one step closer to prison. 
A Federal judge has denied a motion filed by Fattah’s attorneys to keep the former politician out of jail while he continues with his appeal. 
The former Congressman maintains his innocence and a group of his supporters have now sent a letter to President Obama, asking that Fattah be pardoned. 
They cite his contributions to society and questions about the initial charges against him. 
Fattah was convicted on bribery, racketeering, and conspiracy charges in June. 
Last month, he was sentenced to 10 years in prison, and is due to surrender January 25th. Kristen Johanson Kristen Johanson is a reporter for KYW Newsradio. She joined the KYW Newsradio news team after spending four years on the assignment desk at our sister television station, CBS-3, as planning editor. She also worked as a field producer for several...
